docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: Every reflecting mind will, doubtless, fully endorse the sentiment contained in the article which you copied from the Boston Medical and Surgical Journal on Friday last, respecting the habit of taxing the pupils in Public Schools with an excess of study.

headline.main: Letter from John M. Clayton on the Presidency--Know-Nothingism, &c.--Interesting Correspondence.; From the Pennsylvania Inguirer, Oct. 3.

docs.lead_paragraph: It is well known that for some time the Cholera has been making fearful ravages in London, and has even extended to Liverpool, Manchester, and other densely populated places. Added to this, has been another

docs.lead_paragraph: The cholera panic assumes almost incredible proportions in some parts of the south of France. At Genoa, the sanitary measures adopted by the authorities have greatly reduced the numbers of deaths, which may now be counted by tens.
docs.snippet: The cholera panic assumes almost incredible proportions in some parts of the south of France. At Genoa, the sanitary measures adopted by the authorities have greatly reduced the numbers of deaths, which may now be counted by tens.

docs.lead_paragraph: We have now passed beyond what I considered the most sickly season of the year, and the general health of the country is good. The City of Galveston is suffering badly with the yellow fever, and we have had a few cases in Houston, though we think it is now too late for the disease to spread extensively. Thus far we have not had more than ten deaths in all from that disease.

headline.main: HAVANA.; The Concha Feast and the Characteristics of Concha's Better-Half--Recent Edicts, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: We are at the end of the CONCHA feast--with the beginning of the weekly holiday--Sunday--which is not so much a day of rest as we have been anticipating through the three days past. We knew it would end, but not remembering therewith that Sunday is filled with all sorts of amusement besides attending mass in the morning.

docs.lead_paragraph: The were several sudden deaths in the lower part of this city last evening of an alarming nature. JOSEPH COURTNEY, a highly repectable citizen, formerly an Alderman and assessor in this city; JAMES TAYLOR, coal dealer, and Mr. MILHANE and daughter, were all taken by cholera and expired in a few hours. The citizens in the neighborhood are highly excited, and alarm has spread through the city.
